lines.text: One, you are legally dead and therefore cannot hold any property whatsoever.
Ah. Fine.
Two, you are now a female.
Which amounts to much the same thing.
She's lived for 400 years and hardly aged a day; but, because this is England, everyone pretends not to notice.
[speaking in French]
You speak French?
A bit. But most of the English can't... don't want to speak other languages.
But how do they communicate with foreigners?
They speak English louder.
You suffer in advance.
If I were a man...
You?
I might choose not to risk my life for an uncertain cause. I might think that freedom won by death is not worth having. In fact...
You might choose not to be a real man at all. Say, if I were a woman...
You?
I might choose not to sacrifice my life caring for my children, nor my children's children, nor to drown anonymously in the milk of female kindness, but instead, say, to go abroad. Would I then be...
A real woman?
Same person. No difference at all... just a different sex.
The treachery of women!
It has been said to me that the English make a habit of collecting... countries.
I'm offering you my hand.
Oh! Archduke! That's very kind of you, yes. I cannot accept.
But I... I am England. And you are mine.
I see. On what grounds?
That I adore you.
I can find only three words to describe the female sex. None of which are worth expressing.
the house.
Your Majesty, I am forever...
But on one condition. Do not fade. Do not wither. Do not grow old.
Sir, I accept your general rule, that every poet is a fool, but you yourself may serve to show it, that every fool is not a poet.
You're hurt ma'am.
I'm dead, sir.
Dead. That's serious. Can I help?
Will you marry me?
Ma'am... I would gladly, but I fear my ankle is twisted.
The treachery of men!
Nothing thicker than a knife's blade separates melancholy from happiness.
[Orlando starts to tend to the wounds of an enemy soldier]
Leave him.
This is a dying man.
He's not a man. He's the enemy.
Now, what would please you? All that is mine is here for your pleasure.
All you call yours is mine already.
Orlando, to me you were and always will be, whether male or female, the pink, the pearl, and the perfection of your sex.
But you are mine!
But why?
Because... I adore you.
